# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

Here is a function in Julia to clean the column name. The `replace` method can be used with specific patterns and replacements.
```julia
function clean_column(col::String)::String
    return replace(lowercase(col), [" ", "-"] => "_")
end
```
The function takes a string, converts it to lower case using `lowercase`, removes leading or trailing spaces and then replaces all occurrences of space and hyphen with underscore. The result will be something like "my_column".
